cab.content: Printed for the Cabinet. January 1950SECRETCM. (50)1st conclusions copy No, 46CABINET 1 (50)CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street, S. W. 1,on Tuesday, 10th January, 1950, at 10 a.m.PresentThe Eight Hon. C. E. Attlee, M.The Eight Hon. Herbert Morrison,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Eight Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., Minister of Defence.The Eight Hon. Viscount Jowitt,Lord Chancellor.The Eight Hon. A. Creech Jones,M.P., Secretary of .State for theColonies.The Eight Hon. G. A. Isaacs, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Eight Hon. T. Williams, M.P.,Minister of Agriculture andFisheries.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Eight Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Chancellor of theExchequer.The Eight Hon. Viscount Addison,Lord Privy Seal.The Eight Hon. J. Chuter Ede, M.P.,Secretary of State for the home department.The Eight Hon. A. Woodburn, M.P.,Secretary of State for Scotland.The Eight Hon. Aneurin Bevan, M.P.,Minister of Health.The Eight Hon. George Tomlinson,M.P., Minister of Education.The Eight Hon. J. H. Wilson, M.P.,President of the Board of Trade.ContentsGeneral Election\\38224-1 General,Election.(previous reference erence:CM. (49) 56th.Conclusioiia,Minute 2.)The Prime Minister informed the Cabinet of the advice whichhe had tendered to The King about the dissolution of the present parliament and the calling of a new Parliament, which adviceHis Majesty had been pleased to accept.Cabinet Office, S'.W. 1,lQth January, 1950.
